content.description: Begin at road or scramble up road cut and belay from two bolts ontop of the road cut. Follow bolts to the top of the first prominent summit. End to the route is obvious because you would need to rappel to continue any further. First pit is 150 feet, 2nd is about 50 feet. Rappel from webbing down the way you came up using two ropes on your 2nd rappel. Route can use cleaning and chains.
content.protection: 3/8 inch SS Fixe Double expansion. 1" tubuaalr webbing at rappels.
content.location: Start from the road of on top the road cut.

content.description: Hike around the uphill side of the T-Rex formation and then drop down hill with Brontosaur Rock on your left. Head and Shoulders will be on the first up hill wall you come to on Brontosaur. 60 feet protected with two 1/4-inch bolts. Good rock, but this route would benefit from some upgrading.Â
content.protection: two steel 1/4-inch bolts placed in the '70s.

content.description: Brontosaur Rock is easily recognized from the road. It is the long sloping rock that comes all the way down to the road with only a minor 6 foot road cut though the toe of the rock.
